hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: During neutral regimes with realized volatility < implied volatility by >15%, the first catalyst-driven breakout from a 5-day compression range (BB width < 2%) will extend 1.6x further than the initial range height within 24 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression represents pent-up energy. Catalysts act as triggers that release this energy directionally. The IV > RV spread indicates options markets are pricing in movement that hasn't occurred yet, creating asymmetric payoff when breakout finally happens.
entry_conditions: Catalyst occurs (news spike, large options flow, whale movement)
Price breaks 5-day range high/low with >2x average volume
Enter on retest of breakout level (within 0.5%) on 1H timeframe

exit_conditions.take_profit: 1.6x the initial 5-day range height from breakout point
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Back into compression range (beyond 0.8% past breakout)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to extend beyond 1.2x range height, or reverses to mid-range within 12 hours.
